author: Special Correspondent
text:
The West Bengal Assembly on Saturday passed two Bills paving the way for the take over of private sector companies Jessop and Company Limited and Dunlop India Limited both controlled by the Pawan Ruia Group.

On the last day of Assembly Session in the poll bound State, Dunlop India Limited (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking) Bill, 2016 and Jessop and Company Limited (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking) Bill, 2016 were passed by a voice vote.

State’s Industries and Commerce Minister Amit Mitra tabled the Bills in House. The Left and Congress legislators, though did not oppose the Bill, but raised questions on technical and legal issues as to how the take over could be implemented when the matter was sub-judice.

The statement of object and reasons of both the Bills stated, “thousands of employees of the company have not got their dues over substantial period of time” and “are in acute financial distress”. The purpose of the take over was to “sub serve the interest of general public” the Bills pointed out.

In the political circles while the move is being described at an attempt to reach out the distressed labour force of the State, the workers of the two companies hailed the initiative.
title: Bengal House passes Bills for takeover of two firms
